data.title: Canada Place, Vancouver
data.meta_description: Operated by the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, Canada Place forms a modern, yet legendary structure that juts out prominently on the city's bustling harborfront. The structure is famously iconic for its sprawling splendor, replete with five spiked roofs fashioned out of fabric that collectively resemble a ship's sails. Besides being the main cruise ship terminal for the region, Canada Place is home to the city's most striking and eminent facilities, including the Pan Pacific Hotel, the Vancouver Convention Centre, FlyOver Canada, and Vancouver's World Trade Centre. With an unusual roof that asserts a maritime influence, Canada Place blends beautifully with the rest of the harborfront vista.
